user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BinSemTake:
```c
int32 OS_BinSemTake(osal_id_t sem_id)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sem_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_BinSemTake_Impl(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_BinSemTake:
typedef int32_t   int32
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I reviewed the provided function and related symbol definitions for usage of compiler-specific language extensions. No occurrences were found of commonly documented extensions such as: __attribute__, __asm__ / asm, __inline__ (compiler-specific inline), __extension__, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ...; }) as an expression, named address spaces, pragma-based extensions, Microsoft-specific keywords, GCC/Clang builtins, nested functions, variable-length arrays used as extensions, or other vendor-specific syntax. The typedefs (int32, osal_id_t, OS_object_token_t) and macro OS_SUCCESS are standard-conforming constructs. The function uses only standard C constructs (declarations, function call, if-statement, return). Therefore there are no code fragments that need further investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 (language extensions) in the supplied code.
